Articles.Content:
No mater how many struts I put on my spacecraft I can not stiffen the boosters and it's causing a wobble in flight, is anyone else having this problem.

 

Mods I am using;

 

KSP: 1.3 (Win64) - Unity: 5.4.0p4 - OS: Windows 10  (10.0.0) 64bit
B9 Animation Modules - 1.0.6
B9 Part Switch - 1.8.1
BD Animation Modules - 0.6.4.5
Bluedog Design Bureau - 1.1.6
Community Category Kit - 2.0.1
Community Resource Pack - 0.7.1
CommunityTechTree - 3.1.1
DMagic Orbital Science - 1.3.0.10
EVA Transfer - 1.0.7
Firespitter - 7.6
Fuel Tanks Plus - 1.12.1
Interstellar Fuel Switch - 2.6.3
Kerbal Attachment System - 0.6.3
Feline Utility Rover - 0.5.1
Kerbal Inventory System - 1.5
KSP-AVC Plugin - 1.1.6.2
KWRocketryRedux - 3.1.4
Lithobrake Exploration Technologies - 0.4
Infernal Robots - 2.0.11
NearFutureConstruction - 0.8.1
NearFutureElectrical - 0.9
NearFuturePropulsion - 0.9
NearFutureSolar - 0.8.2
Kerbal Planetary Base Systems - 1.4.5
Procedural Parts - 1.2.12
QuantumStrutsContinued - 1.7.1.1
Real Scale Boosters - 0.15
SensiblePumpsCont - 1.2.2
Simple Adjustable Fairings - Plugin - 1.0.1
Simple Adjustable Fairings - KW Rocketry Pack - 1.0.1
SpaceY Lifters - 1.16
TarsierSpaceTechnology - 6.7
TweakScale - 2.3.6

Edited June 23, 2017 by qbert

Try using fewer struts, not more. More struts means more joints and too many joints cause the physics simulation problems.

For a booster, just go with one or two struts. One on the top and optionally, one on the bottom. At the point closest to whatever you're connecting to.

Also, if you aren't using autostrutting, consider trying that. It has to be enabled in one of the main menus and after it's enabled, you will find an option to turn on a part's autostrutting in its right click menu.

Also also, I notice you are using KWR and someone in the KWR thread mentioned having wobbling with the medium and heavy KWR struts. If those are the struts you are using try replacing them with stock struts. (but also still use fewer struts)
